message.content:
cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.CR, cs.SI, cs.CY 

The paper discusses the limitations of the peer review system in allocating funding and proposes the use of bibliometric indicators as a complement. This suggests that the paper is related to research evaluation and assessment, which is a common topic in several arXiv CS sub-categories. cs.DL (Digital Libraries) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval) are likely categories as they deal with information management and retrieval, which are relevant to bibliometric indicators. cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) are also possible categories as they involve evaluating the quality and impact of research. Finally, cs.CY (Computers and Society) may be a relevant category as the paper discusses the challenges of the peer review system, which is a social issue related to the use of technology in research.
